comment: This class was very work heavy. So many assignments every week but the one thing is the final and the midterm were ridiculous. I had an A the entire semester and even passed the final and still brought me down to a B at the last minute and he would not bump me up. The final and the midterm are nothing like his lectures or quizzes. Very Frustrating.

This course was made up of lots of little quizzes and discussion board and then a midterm and a final that were weighted a lot. Both of those assessments were VERY hard. I listened to all his lectures (which were over an hour long each week) and scraped by with a B.

Hip, concise lectures w/engaging content. Weekly discussions and 2+ responses are required, but put forth the effort and you can get an A. Quizzes are an easy 4 questions, but are graded based on 3 questions, so you can miss one and still get a 100. Mid-term & Final are 50% of total grade & must be taken on a lock-down browser (quizzes aren't).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: I took his online US history class and its the easiest class EVER. I seriously put in no effort at all and have a 100% and there is a week left of class. You will use the textbook some but the textbook quizzes are all online. Take it if you want an easy A!!!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I took this class online so there's a lot of reading and videos. Take good notes on his video lectures, he uses these for the tests! Midterm and final require lock down browser and there's not enough time to look up answers from your notes. 2-4 weekly quizzes that are easy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--Tests are tough

comment: Definitely one of the best teachers I've ever had! Makes the class very interesting and very engaging! Would gladly take a class of his again!

Highly recommend. I'm not great with history, so I was apprehensive about taking this, but I learned so much and actually enjoyed it. It's extremely lecture heavy, but it's not a problem because his lectures are really interesting and funny. Grade is made up of daily quizzes over reading assignments, three short papers, a midterm, and a final.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Hilarious and very knowledgeable! There is a quiz every class on the reading from the night before, but they are generally easy. 1 essay based on readings and 1 test per semester. Hoffmann is the best professor I've ever had and I wish I could take his classes again every semester. I highly highly highly recommend.
Professor Hoffmann is so great!! He's so passionate and knowledgable in what he's teaching so his lectures are always interesting. Hilarious and really connects with the students. Easy A. Take him!!

Hoffmann is a great guy. He's probably the chillest professor you will take at Kennesaw. He has quizes before each class for attendance purposes, they're really easy and curves them. His lectures are entertaining and you actually learn. 2 Tests, 3 papers. The papers are fairly easy and the tests are a little difficult but curved. Take him! Easy A!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Mr. Hoffmann is a really great teacher. He has a great personality and his lectures are really interesting. He takes attendance by a daily quiz based off of readings with an iClicker and sometimes a quiz after the lecture too. He gives 3 papers and 2 tests but they're both open note. Textbook is mandatory, but I didn't use mine once. Take him.

Honestly one of the best professors I have had so far. Lectures are interesting and he knows everything very well. Also likes to keep the mood fun by telling jokes and giving random facts. Take him if you can!

I am definitely not a history major and have never really like it, but Hoffman makes history interesting! There's daily chapter quizzes which are very easy if you read. 3 essays and 2 exams. The essays are extremely easy, whereas, the exams are hard. Be sure to pay attention to his lecture because they will be test questions. Overall, great choice.

Took him because of the reviews. I'm sorry but you can't teach an online class and then not understand how to open up anything for the students to look into. He overdoes the busy work because it's an online class-so unless you're ready to do tons of reading, watching unnecessary documents & listen to his mundane lectures every week; refrain.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: Fun teacher, great lectures. Make sure you are there. He gives outlines,. but there is a lot of material on the exams.

Hilarious and well seasoned and history. History has always been a boring class for me but he makes it so interesting and injects fun facts into his lectures. Six one page papers (easy), daily quizzes, and a midterm and final (hard). I would recommend and take his class again.

Professor Hoffmann was honestly the best professor I've ever had. He makes his lectures incredibly interesting and makes the class laugh with every other sentence. He gives a 4-5 question quiz at the beginning of every class, and they're an easy way to get extra credit (If you read the chapter). There are 2 essays and 3 tests and they're all easy.
Very hard tests, but their online and he gives a huge curve. He also gives out essays but their usually simple and grades easily. Great professor overall and easy class

Professor Hoffmann was a very funny professor. History is not my most favored subject, but his fun-filled lectures made it a little bit easier. There are daily four questions quizzes in which he only grades out of three, that means extra credit everyday if you get all of the questions correct! Take advantage of those bc the tests are very difficult

Even though you can't just skip class every day, his lectures are so entertaining that I never wanted to. Lot of chance for easy A grades and his tests are straight foward lecture material. If you skip less than 5 classes and pay attention (and engage in discussion with him, because he will elaborate interestingly) you will get an A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Hoffman was a great professor, but man his tests were hard. Fortunately he curves them. Do not skip class and write the notes from his outlines and lectures and you will do fine. Overall good class, can't complain.
Great class, although there is a 5 question quiz everyday that acts basically as attendance.

Professor  Hoffmann is amazing. His lectures are hilarious and extremely interesting. His exams are extremely difficult, but he grades them on a curve and he gives quizzes over the reading every day that are graded 4/3 so make sure to show up. I wish I could take him again.

probably the BEST professor at KSU! History is so boring to me but I actual found myself looking forward to go to his class and learn about it. He makes it very enjoyable and makes it super funny. An all around awesome personality along with clear instructions on assignments, definitely take him!

I took him for history and I loved it! Lectures are super interesting and he tries hard to make sure you understand the material. Does have mini quizzes at the beginning of every class but super easy with readings! Only two tests (midterm and final) and two essays!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: He goes beyond the textbook that we us. Also, he is hilarious. Who doesn't need a good laugh? I have thoroughly enjoyed his class.  At the beginning of every class there is a quiz over the readings. The quizzes are easy if you read. The tests aren't too bad either. Take notes from the PowerPoints, and you should be fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Professor Hoffmann was by far one of my favorite professors at KSU. I usually hate learning about history, but he made the class enjoyable and made me eager to learn more about the course material every day.  Be prepared to read a lot. He covers a lot of material, but makes it easy to understand and GO TO CLASS!

There is a lot of extra reading in this class, he gives daily quizzes for easy points, 2 documentaries to watch,  a couple of papers and two tests. Show up take notes, do the reading and you will pass. He is a great lecturer.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I did not really show up that much to class or pay attention when I was there, but I somehow passed. He is very chill and hilarious. I would recommend paying attention though because tests and midterms are hard if you do not listen to his lectures. Really solid professor.

Best teacher ive ever had. He is knowledgable about everything and incorparates jokes and laughter into his lectures. I cannot reccomend him enough. I had the chance to take him again, I would take him in a heartbeat!!!!!

Hoffman is great. He's super relatable, pretty funny, and can see things from the students' perspective. Participation points are based on attendance, tests are pretty hard but you can use your notes. Beware the 4 question quizzes at the start of class.

I cannot say enough good things about him. He will help you, but you have to ask. His tests are HARD but he grades papers generously. Reading takes 1-2 hours every non-class day. Reading quiz every class. He is obviously passionate about his field. His was my favorite class this semester and I would absolutely take him again!

His lectures are really engaging and he has a sense of humor. There's a quiz over readings (either from the textbook or online material) every class. They were four questions and you can miss one and get a 100% (perfect quiz score  extra credit in that category). Two essays over readings. The tests were long and extremely difficult, though curved.

Thorough, fast-paced (unbiased) lectures, quizzes every class, two papers on readings, two tests, 40 pages of readings for homework. Drops 3 quizzes and can get a little EC if you answer all quiz questions correctly. I found it very difficult to study for his tests because of the packed lectures. Regardless, it was an enjoyable class.

He really likes and knows his history. He is funny and entertaining. The tests are hard and long, but he curves them. There are quizzes at the beginning of each class that are generally pretty easy and he drops three. Overall, good teacher.
Mr. Hoffmann is funny and likable, but the tests are extremely long and difficult. He does give extra credit though.

He gives really great, interesting lectures. There is a 4 question quiz, taken with a clicker, every class on some reading that he gives us. Most people just look on other peoples clickers because the readings are pretty long. There are 2 papers and a few online quizzes, but they aren't hard. If you put in some effort this class is an easy A!

Professor Hoffmann is a good professor. There is a reading quiz every class period (4 questions), 2 papers, a midterm, and a final. The reading quizzes become very tedious very quickly and the readings are very long. No attendance policy but if you miss class a lot, you won't pass. He's an easy grader on the papers. Puts the notes online.

Great professor. I don't really enjoy history classes but he makes it very enjoyable. Quizzes every class on readings that are 4 questions, the last question goes over to quizzes with low grades. Tests are tough, but only 2 of them, and are curved. It's possible to make an A if you study for the tests.
Really great professor. explains things clearly and is very willing to help when needed. would take again

Awesome!! Prof. Hoffmann is fantastic. She's funny, entertaining, and overall interesting. I had him at 8 AM and I was able to pay attention and enjoy the class. His daily quizzes are short and not required. However, make sure you do them because the quickly lower your grade. His tests are hard, but he curves them. I would take him again.

Professor Hoffman is probably my favorite teacher so far. His lectures are funny and very detailed. He is a history nerd in the best way possible. Grades generously on the papers, tests are tough, but curved. You will READ. Be prepared. It is very interesting stuff, so that makes it much more tolerable. Quizzes everyday so you need to be there.

By far the best 8 a.m. class (if there are any)! Professor Hoffmann is awesome and super passionate about this subject. He makes the information interesting and puts everything in terms you can understand. Attendance is not mandatory, but he does give a quiz every class. He is very funny which makes class interesting! I would 100% take him again!
He was a really inspirational teacher, he made his lectures interesting. Very good teacher very cool guy. Passionate about his subject which is very refreshing.

Professor Hoffmann is without a doubt the best History Teacher I've had, personally. He is incredibly witty, entertaining, and frequently counters a hilarious, sarcastic telling of U.S. History with the jarring truth of the brutal reality of the world. In short, taking his class was like taking from John Green, if Green was more mature, and taller.

Dr. Hoffman is absolutely great. Very intelligent, interested in the material, and also incredibly entertaining. He never fails to surprise the whole class by cracking a hilarious joke or talking about the often "sugar-coated" aspects of history. He's not afraid to tell it like it is...  Two tests of moderate difficulty, two papers, daily quizzes.

Dr. Hoffman is absolutely amazing. Very passionate about what he teaches, and is willing to work with students! Tests are difficult, but there are only two. Attendance is non mandatory but necessary if you don't want zeros on quizzes which he gives out every class. He drops the four lowest grades, and also gives out extra credit which is a plus.

I absolutely love Professor Hoffmann! His lectures are so interesting to listen to because he s very passionate. Two tests, two papers, make sure you study and don't actually b.s. the paper. He sang all the presidents in class once. He's really funny and knows how to keep the student's attention. I would take him again because he's awesome.
Such a great professor! His lectures are super interesting. He has two tests and two papers. There is a quiz every class over the reading, but it's super easy. Definitely recommend!

Professor Hoffman is an amazing professor! His lectures are in depth and he talks with so much passion and it helped me become more interested in the course. There is a lot of reading to be done and he gives super easy quizzes on them and it helps a lot. He is hilarious and super smart and is always available to help you with anything!

Hoffmann is honestly one of my favorite professors, I don't find history very interesting, but he manages to make it fun at 8am. Hes really funny and cracks jokes all the time. He told me to put on here that he sang to us in class once, which is true. He is really thorough in his lectures. 2 tests, 2 papers and reading quizzes. Would recommend!

AWESOME TEACHER!!! only 2 tests, and 2 papers. gives quizzes in the beginning of every class but drops your lowest grade (THEY ARE EASY). Gives study guides and list of all the resources we've used in class for your paper! he's funny and cracks jokes! attendance isn't mandatory but helps your grade! so helpful!

He has a great sense of humor and actually makes history pretty interesting to listen to. There's a lot of reading, but his daily quizzes over the chapters are super short and easy. I would definitely recommend his class.

TAKE  HIS CLASS. Prof. Hoffman has been great all semester. He keeps my attention, and keeps me laughing at 8 in the morning; I'm usually a waking brick that early. 2 tests, 2 essays and doesn't really care if you come to class or not. Daily quizzes on material previously assigned, they aren't too hard. Drops lowest 4 quiz grades.

Great sense of humor. I've never done well in history, but he makes the lectures really interesting and easy to understand. He asks you to write 2 papers and take 2 exams. The paper is due 2 days before the exam, which was a bit stressful. Quizzes taken every class, so you had better read the 40 or so pages between classes. I'm really enjoying it.
Fun class, he is often funny, but requires a lot of reading for a daily quiz and sometimes his lectures go on and on.

Very good professor who is passionate about what he teaches. He assigns readings for each class which he quizzes you on, but they are usually pretty interesting and helpful. Good sense of humor and keeps the class' attention, which is hard to do for an 8 am class

Really good professor. Makes history interesting and fun. I love when you can tell that the professor is passionate about what they teach. Pop quizzes at the beginning of every class over the reading assignments. You HAVE to read in order to do well on the quizzes.
